alert.note: Alert for Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 25 at 8:58PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MID TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of west central Illinois, southeast Iowa and northeast Missouri, including the following counties, in west central Illinois, Hancock and McDonough. In southeast Iowa, Lee. In northeast Missouri, Clark and Scotland. * WHEN...Through mid Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is potential for heavy rain late tonight into early Tuesday morning with amounts in excess of 1 inch possible. However, latest trends indicate the heaviest axis may set up south of the area. The northern edge of the heavy rain could reach up to the far southern portion of the outlook area, mainly along and south of a line from Memphis, Missouri to Keokuk, Iowa to Industry, Illinois. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
